New Records: South Africa equalled the record for most centuries (8) in a single World Cup edition.
Quinton de Kock became the third player to hit 4 centuries in a single World Cup, joining Rohit Sharma and Kumar Sangakkara.
South Africa broke the record for most sixes (76) hit in a single World Cup edition.
Key Match Events: South Africa scored 357 runs, their fourth 350+ total in the tournament.
Quinton de Kock and Rassie van der Dussen both hit centuries, contributing to the team's dominance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa's batting performance highlighted their dominance in the match.
The match contributed to South Africa's strong form in the World Cup.
